intro: Psychotria anisophylla, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia, Peru, and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments at moderate elevations. The plant has been historically significant for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the production of Coca leaves.
